content:
C++ #include <iostream> int main(int argc, char** argv) { std::cout << "Hello, World!" << std::endl; return 0; } Javascript / Typescript console.log("Hello, World!"); Java public class HelloWorld { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, World!"); } } Python 3 print("Hello, World!") C# Console.WriteLine("Hello, World!"); So, Im bored at the moment. Its nearly time to sleep and yet Im working on repairing this blog (which has been neglected from its revamp). So here is a second post containing hello world programs for a variety of languages which I either know, known, or currently have an interest.
Hope you took something from it!
Quinton
summary: C++ #include <iostream> int main(int argc, char** argv) { std::cout << "Hello, World!" << std::endl; return 0; } Javascript / Typescript console.log("Hello, World!"); Java public class HelloWorld { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, World!"); } } Python 3 print("Hello, World!") C# Console.WriteLine("Hello, World!"); So, Im bored at the moment. Its nearly time to sleep and yet Im working on repairing this blog (which has been neglected from its revamp).
title: Hello World (I'm Bored)

title: Projects

content:
Here are some useful links that I personally like to have around beyond just bookmarks (which tend to bury old links with new links) and personal notes.
Linux Links (including Documentation) Red Hat 9 Official Documentation Red Hat’s official documentation on Red Hat 9 (released may 2022)
Rocky Linux A successor to CentOS
Fedora Linux Decently stable biyearly release linux distro upstream of red hat
Nginx Documentation Official Nginx Documentation Official Nginx documentation useful for configurating and administrating nginx web servers
Let’s Encrypt Free tls certificates
certbot Setting up tls certificates
cockpit Web Management system for linux
